result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, James Joseph Merschdorf was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Defendant James Joseph Merschdorf in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:29 PM. All parties have reviewed the report from the State in regards to the NGI plea. Court has reviewed it as well. An individual is also here from Lutheran Social Services (Cheele Waldvogel)  and she has submitted the Order for Conditional Release and Treatment plan. Court will sign the order after reviewing the plan, defendant has previously been found not guilty by reason of mental defect/disease. Court needs to sign the Order for Conditional Release Plan and Order for Placement. Voorhees has gone over all of this with his client, Marschdorf agrees and understands it and its conditions. Nothing further from the State. Voorhees - one other minor issue put on the record - believes the defendant is entitled to credit from 7/21/17 to 8/24/17 (34 days). Court grants 34 days credit and amends the Order to reflect that. Court not ordering involuntary administration of psychotropic meds but is willing to revisit it if it becomes a problem in the future. Waldvogel will submit another Order for the Court to sign with the new change. Adjourned at 4:36 PM.

Defendant James Joseph Merschdorf in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:20 PM. State here for change of plea in follow up for NGI request made by Voorhees at request of defendant. All parties have received pschycologist report. Voorhees asking to follow recommendation for outpatient treatment. Court questions if Merschdorf understands court doesn't have to follow recommendation. Merschdorf understands. Defendant pleads NC to both counts 1 & 2. Court has PLQ and goes over it with defendant. Court finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights, factual basis exists, waiving right to trial by entering his plea, court again explains court does not have to follow any recommendations, defendant understands. Court accepts plea. Voorhees states that parties stipulated to admission of report and asks court to allow defendant to be released to the community, pre-disposition report or another medical examination, feels State and he are willing to make recommendations for conditional release order. Voorhees makes final statement. State makes final statement and asks court to follow doctor's recommendation, continue with out patient treatment. Merschdorf makes statement, remorseful. Court based on doctors reports and stipulations of parties, court finds defendant entered pleas of not guitly by reason of mental defect. Commit to Dept. of Health Services for 12 months and have them prepare report and schedule for review, court will allow him to be released to out-patient treatment as recommended by doctor's report. Court advises defendant must have complete cooperation with Department of Health Services. Court finds no longer able to possess firearm with pentalties given. Court does not enter DNA or costs/fines. Jail credit does not apply. Court will sign order.  Review scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
